text: Apple Inc. reported revenue of $383.3 billion for the fiscal year 2023.
Microsoft's net profit reached $72.7 billion in 2023, with a CAGR of 15% over the past five years.
Alphabet Inc. saw its revenue grow to $282.8 billion, representing a 9% increase year-over-year.
Amazon's operating income was $24.9 billion, while its net sales were $514.0 billion.
Tesla, Inc.'s gross profit margin was approximately 25.6% in Q3 2023.
Facebook, now Meta Platforms, Inc., reported a net income of $39.4 billion.
The company's EBITDA for 2022 was $12.5 billion, a significant increase from the previous year.
Nvidia Corporation's free cash flow exceeded $8 billion in the last quarter.
Salesforce's revenue is projected to grow at a CAGR of 20% between 2023 and 2028.
Adobe Inc. achieved a record quarterly revenue of $4.82 billion.
In 2024, the company aims to reduce its operating expenses by 5%.
The company's diluted EPS for Q1 2024 was $2.50.
Walmart's annual revenue exceeded $600 billion, making it the largest company by revenue.
Costco reported a net income of $1.5 billion for the quarter ending May 2024.
The company's R&D expenses increased by 12% year-over-year, reaching $2.1 billion.
Their total assets are valued at over $1 trillion.
The company's market capitalization exceeds $800 billion.
Earnings per share (EPS) for the company were reported at $4.25.
The dividend yield for the stock is currently 2.8%.
The company's debt-to-equity ratio is 0.75.
Return on equity (ROE) for the last fiscal year was 18.5%.
The Price-to-Earnings Ratio (P/E Ratio) is currently at 25.3.
The company projects a revenue growth of 7-9% for the next fiscal year.
Operating margin improved to 14.2% from 12.8% last year.
The current ratio for the company stands at 1.2, indicating good short-term liquidity.
